text: Thomas Flavel (1793 – July 1829) was an English professional cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1821 to 1828. An all-rounder who bowled and kept wicket, Flavel was mainly associated with Surrey. He made 22 known appearances in first-class matchesCricketArchive. Retrieved on 2 December 2008. and represented the Players in the Gentlemen v Players series. ==References== ==External links== * ==Further reading== * H S Altham, A History of Cricket, Volume 1 (to 1914), George Allen & Unwin, 1962 * Arthur Haygarth, Scores & Biographies, Volumes 1-11 (1744–1870), Lillywhite, 1862–72 Category:1793 births Category:1829 deaths Category:English cricketers Category:English cricketers of 1787 to 1825 Category:English cricketers of 1826 to 1863 Category:Players cricketers Category:Surrey cricketers Category:Godalming Cricket Club cricketers Category:Marylebone Cricket Club cricketers
title: Thomas Flavel
